title: CDC H1N1 Flu Updates
name: CDC H1N1 Flu Updates
description: Centers for Disease Control (CDC) updates for the H1N1 influenza virus

properties.title: School Health Policies and Programs Study 2006: Physical Education and Physical Activity
properties.description: This podcast highlights key school health policy and practice results on physical education and physical activity from the 2006 study.

properties.title: Baby Steps: Learn the Signs. Act Early.
properties.description: CDC recognized the impact of developmental disabilities and invested in a campaign to help parents measure their children's progress by monitoring how they play, learn, speak, and act.

properties.title: School Health Policies and Programs Study 2006: Healthy Eating
properties.description: This podcast highlights key school health policy and practice results on healthy eating from the 2006 study.

properties.title: School Health Policies and Programs Study 2006: Tobacco
properties.description: This podcast highlights key school health policy and practice results on tobacco from the 2006 study.

properties.title: School Health Policies and Programs Study 2006: Overview
properties.description: This podcast provides an overview of key school health policy and practice results from the 2006 SHPPS study.

properties.title: Sickle Cell Disease: What You Should Know
properties.description: This podcast is for a general audience and gives information about sickle cell disease.

properties.title: Get Smart: Know When Antibiotics Work
properties.description: This podcast answers questions from the public about appropriate antibiotic use.

properties.title: Antibiotics: One of the Greatest Discoveries of the 20th Century
properties.description: This podcast provides a brief background about antibiotics and quick tips to help prevent antibiotic resistance.

properties.title: MMWR Article Provides Additional Detail About HIV Incidence in the United States
properties.description: This podcast explores a more in-depth look at HIV incidence in specific U.S. populations, with detailed breakdowns of new HIV infections by race, gender, route of transmission, and age.

properties.title: Put Your Hands Together
properties.description: In this podcast, learn how to help stop the spread of infection and stay healthy. It's easy when you 'Put Your Hands Together.'

properties.title: Is Your Child Safe from Lead Poisoning?
properties.description: In this podcast, Dr. Mary Jean Brown, chief of CDC's Lead Poisoning and Prevention Program, discusses the importance of testing children for lead poisoning, who should be tested, and what parents can do to prevent lead poisoning.

properties.title: Renovate Right: Prevent Lead Poisoning in Children
properties.description: In this podcast, Dr. Maria Doa, Director of the Environmental Protection Agency's (EPA) National Program Chemicals Division, discusses EPA's new rule for renovations, repairs, and painting activities. The new rule includes information on lead-safe work practices when conducting renovations, repairs, and painting in pre-1978 homes and schools to prevent the spread of lead dust.

properties.title: Preparing for the Release of CDC's Recommendations for Partner Services Programs for HIV, Syphilis, Gonorrhea, and Chlamydial Infection
properties.description: This podcast provides information useful to state and local leadership as they prepare for the release of CDC's Recommendations for Partner Services Programs for HIV, Syphilis, Gonorrhea, and Chlamydial Infection. Dr. John Douglas, Director of CDC's  Division of STD Prevention and Dr. Rich Wolitski, Acting Director of CDC's Division of HIV/AIDS Prevention, provide some background information on the development of the Recommendations, summarize the key information and features, and describe what plans are underway to support implementation.

properties.title: Stress Management for Emergency Responders - Introduction
properties.description: This is the first in a series of five video podcasts on stress management for individuals, teams, and agencies working in emergency and humanitarian aid settings. These podcasts examine sources of stress at each level and what individuals, team leaders, and agency management can do to manage the stress. It gives practical guidance on ways to reduce stress and lessen its negative impacts on staff and the mission.  The series is geared toward individuals and agencies working in various crisis settings.

properties.title: The Quiet Killer
properties.description: Each year, nearly 500 die, while as many as 20,000 visit emergency rooms for exposure to carbon monoxide.

properties.title: Take Three Actions to Fight Flu
properties.description: This podcast explains how vaccination, everyday preventive actions, and the correct use of antiviral drugs can help you fight both seasonal flu and 2009 H1N1 flu.

properties.title: Blast Injuries: What Clinicians Need to Know
properties.description: In this podcast, Dr. Richard C. Hunt, Director of the CDC’s Division of Injury Response, National Center for Injury Prevention and Control provides a brief overview for health care providers on how to respond and care for persons injured by an explosion or blast event.

properties.title: HIV Transmission Rates in the United States
properties.description: This podcast describes, in detail, HIV transmission rates in the United States and the success of prevention efforts nationwide.

properties.title: Reflections on Public Health: Captain Hart and Malaria
properties.description: This podcast consists of segments of an interview conducted by Capt. Kathleen McDuffie, CDC, with Capt. Russell Hart, a 100 year old retired sanitary engineer of the U.S. Public Health Service Commissioned Corps as he reflects on his work in malaria control. The interview was conducted in 2006.

properties.title: Reflections on Public Health: Captain Hart and Sanitation
properties.description: This podcast consists of segments of an interview conducted by Capt. Kathleen McDuffie, CDC, with Capt. Russell Hart, a 100 year old retired sanitary engineer of the U.S. Public Health Service Commissioned Corps as he reflects on his work in environmental sanitation and the development of local health departments. The interview was conducted in 2006.

properties.title: HIV/AIDS Advances in Hope
properties.description: This podcast, produced by Discovery Health, provides an overview of the HIV/AIDS epidemic from 1981 through 2008. Footage courtesy of Associated Press (AP). It's part of Discovery Health's continuing medical education (CME) program, Managing Comorbidities of HIV/AIDS, featuring infectious disease expert, Dr. John Bartlett, and former CDC Director, Dr. Julie Geberding.

properties.title: Personal Stories: Why Flu Vaccination Matters
properties.description: In this podcast, moving personal stories help inform parents about the dangers of flu to children and the benefits of vaccination.

properties.title: Stress Management for Emergency Responders - Understanding Responder Stress
properties.description: This is the second in a series of five video podcasts on stress management for individuals, teams, and agencies working in emergency and humanitarian aid settings. These podcasts examine sources of stress at each level and what individuals, team leaders, and agency management can do to manage the stress. It gives practical guidance on ways to reduce stress and lessen its negative impacts on staff and the mission.  The series is geared toward individuals and agencies working in various crisis settings.

properties.title: Stress Management for Emergency Responders - What Responders Can Do
properties.description: This is the third in a series of five video podcasts on stress management for individuals, teams, and agencies working in emergency and humanitarian aid settings. These podcasts examine sources of stress at each level and what individuals, team leaders, and agency management can do to manage the stress. It gives practical guidance on ways to reduce stress and lessen its negative impacts on staff and the mission.  The series is geared toward individuals and agencies working in various crisis settings.

properties.title: Stress Management for Emergency Responders - What Team Leaders Can Do
properties.description: This is the fourth in a series of five video podcasts on stress management for individuals, teams, and agencies working in emergency and humanitarian aid settings. These podcasts examine sources of stress at each level and what individuals, team leaders, and agency management can do to manage the stress. It gives practical guidance on ways to reduce stress and lessen its negative impacts on staff and the mission.  The series is geared toward individuals and agencies working in various crisis settings.

properties.title: Stress Management for Emergency Responders - What Agencies Can Do
properties.description: This is the fifth in a series of five video podcasts on stress management for individuals, teams, and agencies working in emergency and humanitarian aid settings. These podcasts examine sources of stress at each level and what individuals, team leaders, and agency management can do to manage the stress. It gives practical guidance on ways to reduce stress and lessen its negative impacts on staff and the mission.  The series is geared toward individuals and agencies working in various crisis settings.

properties.title: Go With the Flow
properties.description: This podcast discusses the importance of water fluoridation and it's role in oral health.

properties.title: Field Triage Decision Scheme: The National Trauma Triage Protocol
properties.description: In this podcast, Dr. Richard C. Hunt, Director of CDC's Division of Injury Response, provides an overview on the development process and scientific basis for the revised field triage guidelines published in the MMWR Recommendations and Report: Guidelines for Field Triage of Injured Patients, Recommendations of the National Expert Panel on Field Triage.

properties.title: A Need to Know
properties.description: This podcast discusses the importance of African-American men who have sex with other men needing to know their HIV status.

properties.title: National Black HIV/AIDS Awareness Day
properties.description: This podcast features Dr. Kevin Fenton, Director of CDC’s National Center for HIV/AIDS, Viral Hepatitis, STD, and TB Prevention, talking about the HIV epidemic in the African American community and steps everyone can take to stop the spread of HIV.

properties.title: National Women and Girls HIV/AIDS Awareness Day
properties.description: This podcast provides information on the impact of HIV and AIDS on women and girls and the importance of getting tested for HIV.

properties.title: Prevention IS Care
properties.description: This podcast provides an overview of the Prevention IS Care campaign, which provides HIV prevention tools for medical care providers to use on a daily basis with patients who are living with HIV.

properties.title: Health Begins at Home
properties.description: Clean and well-maintained homes can prevent many illnesses and injuries. This podcast discusses how good health begins at home.

properties.title: Act Against AIDS
properties.description: This podcast explores the Act Against AIDS campaign, a five-year, multi-faceted communication campaign designed to contribute to the CDC goal of reducing HIV incidence in the United States.

properties.title: Every Nine and a Half Minutes
properties.description: In the United States, every nine-and-a-half minutes, someone is infected with HIV.

properties.title: Get the Facts
properties.description: Every nine-and-a-half minutes someone you know may have been infected with HIV.

properties.title: Infórmate
properties.description: Cada 9 minutos y medio alquien que tu conoces puede haber sido infectado con el VIH.

properties.title: Responding to Outbreaks
properties.description:
In this podcast, a team of CDC specialists travels to Uganda and tracks the source of a recent Ebola outbreak where CDC scientists are studying 
bats for clues to the Ebola mystery.

properties.title: General Instructions for Disposable Respirators
properties.description: This podcast, intended for the general public, demonstrates how to put on and take off disposable respirators that are to be used in areas affected by the influenza outbreak.

properties.title: H1N1 Flu and Antiviral Drugs
properties.description: This podcast discusses the use of antiviral drugs for treating and preventing the H1N1 flu virus.

properties.title: Clean Hands Help Prevent the Flu
properties.description: Clean hands can help prevent the spread of infectious diseases, such as flu. This podcast explains the proper way to wash your hands.

properties.title: H1N1 Message from the Acting Surgeon General
properties.description: In this podcast, Acting Surgeon General Dr. Steven Galson discusses what you can do to protect yourself from H1N1 flu.

properties.title: Manténgase Informado Sobre la Influenza H1N1
properties.description: Este podcast habla sobre las medidas básicas que usted puede tomar para protegerse de cualquier enfermedad infecciosa, incluido el nuevo virus de la influenza H1N1.

properties.title: Stay Informed About Novel H1N1 Influenza
properties.description: This podcast discusses things you can do everyday to avoid getting sick from infectious diseases, such as the novel H1N1 flu.

properties.title: Crisis and Emergency Risk Communications: Countering Stigmatization
properties.description: In this podcast, CDC's Dr. Barbara Reynolds defines stigmatization, describes how stigmatization can occur in a community, and discusses activities that response officials and communication professionals can do to prevent or confront stigmatization.

properties.title: Las manos limpias ayudan a prevenir la influenza (Clean Hands Help Prevent the Flu)
properties.description: Las manos limpias ayudan a prevenir la propagación de enfermedades infecciosas, como la influenza. Este podcast explica la manera correcta de lavarse las manos.

properties.title: H1N1 Flu Awareness: Hygiene
properties.description: This podcast briefly discusses ways you can protect yourself from novel H1N1 flu.

properties.title: Novel H1N1 Flu Awareness: Community
properties.description: This podcast briefly discusses community planning related to a novel H1N1 flu outbreak.

properties.title: Mensajes importantes sobre la influenza H1N1: Higiene (H1N1 Flu Awareness: Hygiene)
properties.description: Este podcast aborda brevemente las formas de protegerse contra el virus nuevo de la influenza H1N1.

properties.title: Mensajes importantes sobre la influenza H1N1: Comunidad (H1N1 Flu Awareness: Community)
properties.description: Este podcast aborda brevemente los planes de la comunidad frente al brote del virus nuevo de la influenza H1N1.

properties.title: In the Swim of Things
properties.description: In this podcast, CDC's Dr. Michael Beach discusses the superbug, <i>Cryptosporidium</i>, a common cause of recreational water illness.

properties.title: How to Prevent Getting and Spreading Novel H1N1 Flu
properties.description: In this podcast, CDC's Dr. Joe Bresee describes how to prevent giving and getting novel H1N1 flu.

properties.title: Crisis and Emergency Risk Communications: Best Practices
properties.description: In this podcast, CDC's Dr. Barbara Reynolds discusses best practices in crisis and emergency risk communication. She characterizes the initial phase of the crisis communication lifecycle and describes the five most common mistakes made in emergency communication to the public and how to counter them.

properties.title: Novel H1N1 Flu - Creating a Safe and Healthy Workplace
properties.description: This podcast helps businesses understand how novel H1N1 flu can affect their business and how to keep their workers and worksites safe.

properties.title: Update on HPV Vaccine Recommendations for Pre-teens
properties.description: In this podcast, Dr. Melinda Wharton discusses the differences between the two HPV vaccines licensed by the FDA and CDC recommendations for the vaccination of pre-teen girls and boys.

properties.title: Living with HIV: Patients Perspective
properties.description: This podcast showcases three people who are living with HIV. The patients share their experiences of being diagnosed with HIV, of the treatments they are undergoing, and on taking responsibility for their health.

properties.title: Binge Drinking
properties.description: This podcast explores the health risks of binge drinking and discusses effective community strategies to prevent it.

properties.title: Behind the Scenes: CDC Emergency Operations Center
properties.description:
In this podcast, you can take a tour of CDC's command center for 
emergency responses to domestic and international public health threats.

properties.title: Feeding Health: Thoughts on Healthy Food for a Healthy Planet
properties.description: In this podcast, Food Rules author Michael Pollan discusses American food culture and gives his thoughts on how food can impact human and environmental health.

properties.title: Feeding Health: Michael Pollan on Improving Public Health through the Food Systems
properties.description: In this podcast, author Michael Pollan discusses his March 2009 visit to CDC and offers his thoughts on the intersection between the government, the food systems, and public health.

properties.title: <i>E. Coli</i> Outbreak and Raw Cookie Dough (June 24, 2009)
properties.description: This CDC podcast provides information about the June 2009 E. coli outbreak related to raw cookie dough, including ways to protect yourself.

properties.title: Advances in Crash Response
properties.description: In this podcast, Dr. Richard C. Hunt, Director of CDC's Division of Injury Response, provides an overview on the benefits of using an Advanced Automatic Collision Notification system, or AACN, to help with emergency triage of people injured in vehicle crashes.

properties.title: Novel H1N1 Flu and Camp
properties.description: This podcast gives tips to stay healthy and help prevent infection with novel H1N1 flu if your child or someone you know is going to camp.

properties.title: Voices of Experience: Living with HIV. Pamela.
properties.description: This podcast showcases Pamela, a woman living with HIV, as she tells her story.

properties.title: Voices of Experience: Living with HIV. Denise.
properties.description: This podcast showcases Denise, a woman living with HIV, as she tells her story.

properties.title: Voices of Experience: Living with HIV. ODell.
properties.description: This podcast showcases ODell, a man living with HIV, as he tells his story.

properties.title: Voices of Experience: Living with HIV. Doug.
properties.description: This podcast showcases Doug, a man living with HIV, as he tells his story.

properties.title: Finding A Balance
properties.description: Achieving and maintaining a healthy weight is about FINDING A BALANCE through healthy eating and physical activity.

properties.title: Tracks: EPHT Massachusetts Case Study
properties.description: This podcast highlights the Massachusetts Environmental Public Health Tracking Network and features commentary from Massachusetts Department of Public Health Associate Health Commissioner Suzanne Condon.

properties.title: Tracks: Working with Partners to Achieve Success
properties.description: This podcast explores the partnerships that played a crucial role in building the National Environmental Public Health Tracking Network.

properties.title: Shepard Award Winners, Part 1: Dr. Stephen Thacker
properties.description: This podcast highlights the accomplishments of Dr. Stephen Thacker, recipient of the prestigious 2009 CDC Charles C. Shepard Award.

properties.title: Shepard Award Winners, Part 2: Dr. Tracie Williams
properties.description: This podcast highlights the accomplishments of Dr. Tracie Williams, recipient of the prestigious 2009 CDC Charles C. Shepard Award.

properties.title: Parents, School Success, and Health
properties.description: In this podcast, Dr. William Jeynes, CDC Parenting Speaker Series guest, discusses the importance of parental involvement in children's academic success and lifelong health.

properties.title: Tracks:  A National Environmental Public Health Tracking Network Overview
properties.description: In this podcast, Dr. Mike McGeehin, Director of CDC's Division of Environmental Hazards and Health Effects, provides an overview of the National Environmental Public Health Tracking Network. It highlights the Tracking Network's goal, how it will improve public health, its audience, and much more.

properties.title: Have You Heard?
properties.description: Pre-teens, adolescents, and college freshmen who live in dorms are at an increased risk for meningococcal disease. This podcast discusses routine vaccination recommendations for 11-18 year olds.

properties.title: The Story of Iyal
properties.description: In this podcast, a mother tells her compelling story about a family living with fetal alcohol spectrum disorders.

properties.title: CDC Tracking Network: Working Towards a Healthier Planet for Healthy People
properties.description: This is an engaging video podcast geared to raise awareness of environmental public health and our nation's need for the Tracking Network.

properties.title: Consejos para los adolescentes latinos que adoptan ambas culturas (Tips for Latino teens)
properties.description: Podcast para los adolescentes latinos: Este podcast ofrece consejos útiles a los adolescentes latinos sobre cómo encontrar un equilibrio entre su cultura de origen y la cultura estadounidense, con el fin de disfrutar de una vida más feliz y saludable.

properties.title: Los adolescentes latinos son más felices y saludables si sus familias adoptan ambas culturas (Latino teens happier, healthier)
properties.description: Podcast para los padres latinos: Este podcast proporciona sugerencias a los padres de adolescentes latinos sobre lo que pueden hacer para ayudar a sus hijos a tener una vida más feliz y saludable.

properties.title: Vaccination Rates Remain High
properties.description: Dr. Melinda Wharton of CDC's National Center for Immunization and Respiratory Diseases discusses results from the most recent National Immunization Survey, which indicates that vaccination rates for children aged less than three years remain stable at high levels.

properties.title: Injury Prevention Research
properties.description: Research provides the knowledge that we need to understand what is possible, what is not, and the best way to proceed in our intervention efforts.

properties.title: Seasonal Influenza 2009-2010: ACIP Vaccination Recommendations
properties.description: In this podcast, Dr. Tony Fiore discusses who should be vaccinated against seasonal flu during the 2009-2010 season. He explains who is at risk for severe illness from the flu and discusses the benefits of  vaccination.

properties.title: 2009 H1N1 ACIP Vaccination Recommendations
properties.description: In this podcast, Dr. Tony Fiore discusses who should be vaccinated against 2009 H1N1 flu during the 2009-2010 season. He explains the target groups for vaccination, and how these groups differ from those recommended for seasonal flu vaccination.

properties.title: Pharmacists Can Make the Difference
properties.description: In this podcast, a pharmacist counsels a frustrated mother about  appropriate antibiotic use and symptomatic relief options for her son's cold.

properties.title: Novel H1N1 Flu and HIV-Infected Adults and Adolescents
properties.description: In this podcast, Dr. John Brooks, of CDC's HIV/AIDS Prevention Program, discusses CDC's Interim Guidance for HIV-infected adults and adolescents regarding the novel H1N1 flu virus. He explains that while HIV-infected individuals may experience more severe complications of the H1N1 virus, the information available so far doesn't seem to indicate that people living with HIV infection are at greater risk of getting the novel H1N1 flu.

properties.title: Hand Hygiene Saves Lives: Patient Admission Video (Short Version)
properties.description: This podcast is for hospital patients and visitors. It emphasizes two key points to help prevent infections: the importance of practicing hand hygiene while in the hospital, and that it's appropriate to ask or remind healthcare providers to practice hand hygiene.

properties.title: World Heart Day
properties.description: For World Heart Day, learn more about what heart-healthy steps you can take in the workplace.

properties.title: National Cholesterol Education Month
properties.description: Do you know your cholesterol numbers? Your doctor can do a simple test to check your cholesterol levels and help you make choices that lower your risk for heart disease and stroke.

properties.title: Mental Health of Survivors of the 2010 Haitian Earthquake Living in the United States
properties.description: Thousands of survivors of the 2010 Haitian Earthquake are currently living in the United States.  This podcast features a brief non-disease-specific interview with Dr. Marc Safran, CDC's longest serving psychiatrist, about a few of the mental health challenges such survivors may face.

properties.title: Get Tested. Make it Contagious.
properties.description: This podcast is part of the "Get Tested. Make it Contagious" campaign, which is designed to raise awareness of sexually transmitted diseases (STDs) and increase testing among college students.

properties.title: Hepatitis in the United States
properties.description: In this podcast, Dr. John Ward, Director of CDC’s Division of Viral Hepatitis, discusses the different types of viral hepatitis and how they can be prevented. He also describes how hepatitis is transmitted and treated.

properties.title: Institute of Medicine’s Report on Viral Hepatitis
properties.description: In this podcast, Dr. John Ward, Director of CDC’s Division of Viral Hepatitis, discusses the 2010 report, Hepatitis and Liver Cancer: A National Strategy for Prevention and Control of Hepatitis B and C, from the Institute of Medicine.

properties.title: Stay Healthy With Elmo
properties.description: In this podcast, Elmo teaches kids the basics of staying healthy.

properties.title: Learn How to Sneeze With Elmo
properties.description: In this podcast, Elmo teaches kids how to sneeze to avoid spreading germs.

properties.title: Wash Your Hands With Elmo
properties.description: In this podcast, Elmo encourages kids to wash their hands to stay healthy.

properties.title: Learn to Cough or Sneeze With Elmo
properties.description: In this podcast, Elmo teaches kids how to cough or sneeze to avoid spreading germs.

properties.title: Influenza Round Table: Don't Get, Don't Spread
properties.description: In this podcast, Dr. Joe Bresee describes how to keep from getting the flu and spreading it to others.

properties.title: Influenza Round Table: Take Three
properties.description: In this podcast, Dr. Joe Bresee describes how to keep from getting the flu and spreading it to others by taking these three steps.

properties.title: Influenza Round Table: Warning Signs
properties.description: In this podcast, Dr. Joe Bresee describes the main symptoms of flu, including the new H1N1 flu, and when it is serious enough to seek medical help.

properties.title: Influenza Round Table: Antiviral Drugs
properties.description: In this podcast, Dr. Joe Bresee explains the nature of antiviral drugs and how they are used.

properties.title: Blood Sugar & Fears
properties.description: In this video, Dr. Ann Albright, director of CDC's Division of Diabetes Translation, and Dr. Edward Gregg, chief of the division's Epidemiology and Statistics Branch, discuss who is at high risk for type 2 diabetes and what lifestyle changes can help prevent or delay the disease.

properties.title: New Information About Premature Births (For Healthcare Providers)
properties.description: Dr. William Callaghan describes the findings from a CDC study which sought to understand how preterm birth contributes to infant mortality rates in the United States.

properties.title: New Information About Premature Births (For Consumers)
properties.description: A new study finds that prematurity is the most frequent cause of infant death in the United States. Learn more.

properties.title: CDC Disease Detective Camp
properties.description: The CDC Disease Detective Camp gives rising high school juniors and seniors exposure to key aspects of the CDC, including basic epidemiology, infectious and chronic disease tracking, public health law, and outbreak investigations. The camp also helps students explore careers in public health.

properties.title: World Rabies Day 2010
properties.description: In this podcast, Dr. Charles Rupprecht, Chief of the CDC's Rabies Program, discusses rabies in the United States and globally.

properties.title: Building the Capacity of the HIV Prevention Workforce
properties.description: This podcast provides an overview of CDC's HIV prevention capacity building efforts with community-based organizations and health departments.

properties.title: H1N1 Flu Vaccine – Why the Delay?
properties.description: This short podcast will help you understand how flu vaccines are made, why manufacturing and shipping vaccine take so long, and how you can find flu vaccines near you.

properties.title: Tips to Reduce Your Risk of <i>Salmonella</i> from Eggs
properties.description: Eggs are one of nature's most nutritious and economical foods, but you must take special care when handling and preparing fresh eggs and egg products to avoid food poisoning.

properties.title: Tips to Reduce Your Risk of Getting a <i>Salmonella</i> Infection from Dry Pet Food
properties.description: <i>Salmonella</i> is a germ, or type of bacteria, that's commonly spread through contaminated food, water, or contact with infected animals.  This includes pets like dogs and cats who can appear healthy, even when carrying these germs.

properties.title: Public Health and Homelessness
properties.description: Homelessness in the 21st century is an ongoing problem, increasing due to the country's recent economic downturn, especially in urban areas.  This video podcast discusses how homelessness impacts health and what public health professionals can do about it.

properties.title: Coping with Traumatic Events
properties.description: Tragedies affect all of us in different ways. Some people might react to the stress immediately, while others may not experience stress until later.

properties.title: Recognizing and Preventing Whooping Cough (Pertussis)
properties.description: In this podcast, Tami Skoff, a mother of two and epidemiologist with CDC, discusses the symptoms of whooping cough (pertussis) and how to prevent it. She discusses the importance of getting everyone vaccinated, especially those who will have close contact with an infant.

properties.title: Reconocimiento y prevención de la tos ferina (Pertussis) (Recognizing and Preventing Whooping Cough)
properties.description: En este podcast, Tami Skoff, epidemióloga de los CDC y madre de dos hijos, habla de los síntomas de la tos ferina (pertussis) y la forma en que puede ser prevenida. Skoff resalta la importancia de que todas las personas se vacunen, en especial aquellas que están en contacto cercano con bebés.

properties.title: Reconocimiento y prevención de la tos ferina (Pertussis) 2 (Recognizing and Preventing Whooping Cough)
properties.description: Este podcast insta a que todas las personas se vacunen contra la tos ferina, especialmente aquellas que estén en contacto cercano con bebés.

properties.title: Recognizing and Preventing Whooping Cough 2 (Pertussis)
properties.description: This podcast encourages everyone to get vaccinated against whooping cough (pertussis), especially those who will have close contact with an infant.

properties.title: Teen Vaccination Coverage Increasing
properties.description: Vaccination coverage among adolescents is on the rise, but there is room for improvement. Dr. Melinda Wharton of CDC's National Center for Immunization and Respiratory Diseases discusses results from the most recent National Immunization Survey of vaccination rates for teens aged 13 to 17 years.

properties.title: Program Collaboration and Service Integration At-a-Glance
properties.description: Dr. Kevin A. Fenton, Director of CDC's National Center for HIV/AIDS, Viral Hepatitis, STD, and TB Prevention, discusses program collaboration and service integration, a strategy that promotes better collaboration between public health programs and supports appropriate service integration at the point-of-care.

properties.title: Health Inequities and HIV, Viral Hepatitis, TB, and STDs
properties.description: Dr. Kevin A. Fenton, Director of CDC's National Center for HIV/AIDS, Viral Hepatitis, STD, and TB Prevention (NCHHSTP), discusses health inequities in the United States and how NCHHSTP research, policies, and programs can address them.

properties.title: Mixing Tamiflu® with Sweet Liquids
properties.description: If your doctor prescribes Tamiflu® capsules for your child and your child cannot swallow them, this podcast describes how to mix the contents of the capsules with a sweet thick liquid so they can be given that way.

properties.title: Antiviral Drugs: Seasonal Flu
properties.description: In this podcast, Dr. Joe Bresee explains the nature of antiviral drugs and how they are used for seasonal flu.

properties.title: Don't Get, Don't Spread: Seasonal Flu
properties.description: In this podcast, Dr. Joe Bresee describes how to keep from getting the seasonal flu and spreading it to others.

properties.title: Warning Signs: Seasonal Flu
properties.description: In this podcast, Dr. Joe Bresee describes the main symptoms of seasonal flu and when it is serious enough to seek medical help.

properties.title: Take Three: Seasonal Flu
properties.description: In this podcast, Dr. Joe Bresee describes how to keep from getting seasonal flu and spreading it to others by taking these three steps.

properties.title: Shepard Award Winners, Part 3: Dr. Larissa Roux
properties.description: This podcast highlights the accomplishments of Dr. Larissa Roux, recipient of the prestigious 2009 CDC Charles C. Shepard Award.

properties.title: Global Disease Detectives
properties.description: This podcast documents U.S. efforts to prevent, detect, and control emerging infectious diseases, such as SARS and pandemic influenza.

properties.title: Influenza 2010-2011: ACIP Vaccination Recommendations
properties.description: In this podcast targeted to clinicians, Dr. Joe Bresee discusses who should be vaccinated against seasonal flu during the 2010-2011 season. He explains who is at risk for severe illness from the flu and discusses the benefits of vaccination.

properties.title: Health Inequities among Men who have Sex with Men
properties.description: Dr. Richard Wolitski, Deputy Director for Behavioral and Social Science in CDC's Division of HIV/AIDS Prevention, discusses how the health of men who have sex with men may be influenced by prejudice and discrimination and impacted by policies, laws, and economic factors.

properties.title: Global Disease Detectives in Kibera
properties.description: In partnership with our disease detectives, urban poor open their homes to the world to prevent and control emerging diseases.

properties.title: Talking to Your Patients: A Clinician’s Guide to Treating Mild Traumatic Brain Injury
properties.description: This podcast describes how to talk to your patients and provide health information about mild traumatic brain injury (mild TBI) that may help ease their concerns and can give them tools to help speed their recovery.

properties.title: New CDC Lead and Pregnancy Recommendation Report 2010
properties.description: This podcast addresses the highlights of the new CDC Lead and Pregnancy Recommendation Report for 2010.

properties.title: Pink Eye: What To Do
properties.description: In this podcast, CDC's Adam Cohen, MD, a pediatrician and parent, discusses conjunctivitis (pink eye), a common eye condition in children and adults. He reviews pink eye causes and treatment, suggestions on when to call or visit a doctor, and practical tips to prevent pink eye from spreading.

properties.title: Parents Are the Key to Safe Teen Drivers
properties.description: This podcast offers information to help parents keep their teen drivers safer on the road.

properties.title: Mantoux Tuberculin Skin Test
properties.description: Learn how to evaluate people for latent TB infection with the Mantoux tuberculin skin test.  This podcast includes sections on administering and reading the Mantoux tuberculin skin test, the standard method for detecting latent TB infection since the 1930s.

properties.title: 2009 H1N1 Information for Parents who have Children with High-Risk Medical Conditions
properties.description: This podcast, intended for parents, discusses high-risk medical conditions that put children at risk for flu complications and how to protect children from the flu.

properties.title: Snort Sniffle Sneeze: No Antibiotics Please
properties.description: Antibiotics aren't always the answer for sneezes or sore throats. This podcast discusses ways to feel better without antibiotics.

properties.title: Hand, Foot, and Mouth Disease
properties.description: In this podcast, CDC's Adam Cohen, MD, a pediatrician and dad, talks about hand, foot, and mouth disease; its symptoms; and practical tips to prevent your family from getting sick with the virus.

properties.title: Pregnant Women Need a Flu Shot
properties.description: This podcast explains why pregnant women need a flu shot.

properties.title: Pregnant Women: Know the Signs and Symptoms of Flu
properties.description: This podcast is targeted to pregnant women and explains 1) the signs and symptoms of the flu, and 2) what to do if you experience and signs and symptoms. This podcast is NOT a substitute for the advice of your doctor or health care provider. It is intended for educational purposes only.

properties.title: Homeless and Policy – Part I
properties.description: Homelessness in the 21st century is an ongoing problem, increasing due to the country's recent economic downturn, especially in urban areas. This podcast discusses how homelessness impacts policy and what public health professionals can do about it.

properties.title: Homelessness and Health – Part I
properties.description: Homelessness in the 21st century is an ongoing problem, increasing due to the country's recent economic downturn, especially in urban areas. This podcast discusses how homelessness impacts health and what public health professionals can do about it.

properties.title: Homeless and Policy – Part II
properties.description: Homelessness in the 21st century is an ongoing problem, increasing due to the country's recent economic downturn, especially in urban areas. This podcast discusses how homelessness impacts policy and what public health professionals can do about it.

properties.title: Homelessness and Health – Part II
properties.description: Homelessness in the 21st century is an ongoing problem, increasing due to the country's recent economic downturn, especially in urban areas. This podcast discusses how homelessness impacts health and what public health professionals can do about it.

properties.title: Business/Employers Influenza Toolkit
properties.description: This podcast promotes the "Make It Your Business To Fight The Flu" toolkit for Businesses and Employers. This toolkit provides information and recommended strategies to help businesses and employers promote the 2010 – 2011 seasonal flu vaccine. Additionally, employers will find flyers, posters, and other materials to post and distribute in the workplace.

properties.title: Learn More Breathe Better
properties.description: Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) is a serious lung disease that makes breathing very difficult and can affect your quality of life. Learn the causes of COPD and what you can do to prevent it.

properties.title: Preventing Type 2 Diabetes
properties.description: This podcast discusses CDC's work to prevent type 2 diabetes and to reduce complications of diabetes. It also focuses on establishing lifestyle intervention programs for overweight or obese people at high risk of developing diabetes.

properties.title: Hablemos de la Influenza
properties.description: En la charla, un médico responde a las preguntas frecuentes sobre la vacuna contra la influenza (gripe).

properties.title: I Never Get The Flu
properties.description: If you think 2009 H1N1 flu can't affect you, your family, or your friends—think again. Take 60 seconds to watch this reminder on why vaccination is so important. All of the excuses any of us make don't stand a chance against this serious disease.

properties.title: A Time To Act
properties.description: This podcast reviews the steps you can take to keep your family safe in case of a home fire.

properties.title: Los padres son la clave: ayude proteger a su adolescente que está empezando a manejar (Parents Are the Key—Help Protect Your Teen Driver)
properties.description: En esta entrevista, Arleen Greenspan, PhD., nos brinda información sobre la campaña de comunicación, Los padres son la clave, cuyo objetivo es promover la seguridad de los adolescentes al conducir.

properties.title: Parents Are the Key—Help Protect Your Teen Driver
properties.description: In this interview-style podcast, Arlene Greenspan, PhD, shares information about CDC's communications campaign - "Parents Are the Key" - to promote safe teen driving.

properties.title: TB Poem: Expressions from Us to You
properties.description: Regina D. Bess from CDC's Division of Tuberculosis Elimination wrote this poem for World TB Day 2007 to convey messages of commitment and hope in the efforts to eliminate TB. It captures the essence of the TB program's mission and dedication to the communities it serves.

properties.title: Tracks: The New York City Rat Information Portal
properties.description: This podcast, featuring Daniel Kass, Acting Deputy Commissioner of Environmental Health for the New York City (NYC) Department of Health and Mental Hygiene, provides information about the NYC Rat Information Portal. It details the background and uses of the Rat Portal, as well as next steps for the NYC Environmental Public Health Tracking Program.

properties.title: Deck Yourself with Flu Protection Song
properties.description: This song (sung to the tune of Deck the Halls) describes actions you can take to protect yourself and others from the flu. Sing along!

properties.title: CDC's Response in Darfur
properties.description: CDC has been assisting in the response to the recent Darfur crisis since 2004. Leisel Talley, an epidemiologist in the International Emergency and Refugee Health Branch, shares how we helped, some challenges we faced and how CDC''s contributions were used.

properties.title: CDC's Response to Complex Humanitarian Emergencies
properties.description: CDC has been responding to complex humanitarian emergencies for more than 30 years, working in places such as Afghanistan, Darfur, Chad and Asia for the tsunami among many others.  Michael Gerber, Deputy Chief of the International Emergency and Refugee Health Branch, shares how CDC helps in these challenging situations and gives examples from past responses.

properties.title: CDC's Work with Innovative Technology
properties.description: CDC is working on two innovative approaches which use technology to help gather data quickly and accurately in complex humanitarian emergencies. Mark Phelan, Humanitarian Analyst, and Michael Gerber, Deputy Branch Chief, who both work in the International Emergency and Refugee Health Branch talk about remote sensing technology and health information systems.

properties.title: Clean Air and Water
properties.description: The air we breathe and the water we drink are both vital components of our health.  Nevertheless, bacteria, pollutants, and other contaminates can alter life-giving air and water into health-threatening hazards.  Learn about how scientists at the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention work to protect the public from air and water-related health risks.

properties.title: Global Climate Change
properties.description: The hottest ten years on record have all occurred since 1995. While we cannot fully predict the impact of these changes on society and public health, we need to prepare for the implication of health issues associated with global climate change.  This report highlights CDC observations on the issue and identifies priority areas for future projects.

properties.title: Hazardous Chemicals
properties.description: Chemicals are a part of our daily lives, providing many products and modern conveniences. With more than three decades of experience, The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) has been in the forefront of efforts to protect and assess people's exposure to environmental and hazardous chemicals.  This report provides information about hazardous chemicals and useful tips on how to protect you and your family from harmful exposure.

properties.title: Healthy Places
properties.description: Every person has a stake in environmental public health. As the environment deteriorates, so does the physical and mental health of the people within it. Healthy places are those designed and built to improve the quality of life for all people who live, work, worship, learn, and play within their borders -- where every person is free to make choices amid a variety of healthy, available, accessible, and affordable options.  The CDC recognizes significant health issues and places that are vital in developing the Healthy Places program and provides examples in this report.

properties.title: Climate Change: Science, Health and the Environment
properties.description: Climate Change: Science, Health and the Environment Howard Frumkin, MD, DrPH, Director of CDC's National Center for Environmental Health/Agency for Toxic Substances and Disease Registry, discusses the science of climate change, the potential for shifts in the natural world to affect our wellbeing, and the challenges of emerging issues in environmental health.

properties.title: Cervical Cancer
properties.description: Did you know that cervical cancer rates differ by race/ethnicity and region? Or that cervical cancer can usually be prevented if precancerous cervical lesions are found by a Pap test and treated? Find out how getting regular Pap tests can save a woman's life.

properties.title: Five Tips for a Safer and Healthier Life
properties.description: This podcast focuses on five simple steps you can take to live a safer, healthier life.

properties.title: The 12 Ways to Health Holiday Song
properties.description: This song (sung to the tune of The Twelve Days of Christmas) describes how to stay safe and healthy during the holidays and all year long.

properties.title: Early Hearing Detection and Intervention: Can Your Baby Hear?
properties.description: This podcast discusses how important it is that every child receives a hearing screening as soon as possible after birth.  It also gives specific ways that parents and health providers can find out if a child has a possible hearing loss and where to get further information.   (Created 6/5/2007 by the Early Hearing Detection and Intervention Program, NCBDDD).

properties.title: Detección auditiva e intervención tempranas: ¿puede oír su bebé?
properties.description: Este podcast es una traducción fiel de la conversación original en inglés con la doctora June Holstrum y la audióloga Pam Mason, y habla sobre la importancia de hacer una prueba exploratoria de la audición a todos los bebés tan pronto como sea posible después del nacimiento. También proporciona información que puede ayudar a los padres y proveedores de salud a determinar si un niño tiene pérdida auditiva, y a encontrar recursos adicionales. (Creado el 6/5/2007 por el Programa de Detección Auditiva e Intervención Tempranas del Centro Nacional de Defectos Congénitos y Deficiencias del Desarrollo, NCBDDD).

properties.title: Overview of the CDC 2008 Yellow Book for Healthcare Providers
properties.description: The “Yellow Book" (Health Information for International Travel) is published every two years by CDC as a reference for those who advise international travelers of health risks and preventive measures. It is written primarily for health care providers, although others might find it useful.

properties.title: Overview of the CDC 2008 Yellow Book for the Public
properties.description: The “Yellow Book" (Health Information for International Travel) is published every two years by CDC as a reference for those who advise international travelers of health risks and preventive measures. It is written primarily for health care providers, although others might find it useful.

properties.title: Roadmap to Maintaining Cognitive Health
properties.description: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) and the Alzheimer's Association released <em>The National Public Health Road Map to Maintaining Cognitive Health</em> at the International Conference on the Prevention of Dementia in Washington, DC on June 10, 2007. The Road Map lays out a shared vision for a work in progress, one that builds on the foundation of the work done to date, establishes a framework within which to view the findings of that work, links related and complementary activities, and shapes the work of the future.

properties.title: Tracks: National Environmental Public Health Tracking Network Announces New State Grantees
properties.description: This podcast, featuring Dr. Judith Qualters, Chief of the Environmental Public Health Tracking Branch, announces the six new state grantees added to the Environmental Public Health Tracking Network (Tracking Network).  It details how this expansion will improve the Tracking Network and other ways the network is expanding.

properties.title: <i>Salmonella</i> Infection and Water Frogs
properties.description: This podcast, featuring lead investigator Shauna Mettee, discusses the first known outbreak of Salmonella in people due to contact with water frogs.

properties.title: National Latino AIDS Awareness Day
properties.description: Dr. Ken Dominquez discusses the significance of this awareness day and why HIV continues to pose a major threat to the health and well-being of Latinos in the United States.

properties.title: Día Nacional para La Concientización del SIDA
properties.description: El Dr. Ken Domínguez discute la importancia de este día y porque el VIH sigue siendo una amenaza para la salud y el bienestar de Latinos en los Estados Unidos.

properties.title: Methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus (MRSA)
properties.description: Key facts about MRSA infections in the United States, including schools and healthcare settings.

properties.title: Heads Up! Play it Safe When it Comes to Concussions
properties.description: As many as 3.8 million sports- and recreation-related concussions are estimated to occur in the United States each year. This podcast is a radio interview with CDC's Dr. Julie Gilchrist on the newly available “Heads Up: Concussion in Youth Sports" tool kit, which was developed to provide information to coaches, parents, and athletes involved in youth sports on preventing, recognizing, and responding to a concussion.

properties.title: Residential Fire H.E.L.P.
properties.description: Dr. Ileana Arias, Director of CDC’s National Center for Injury Prevention and Control, describes the Residential Fire Homebound Elderly Lifeline Project (Fire H.E.L.P.), a project that CDC is working on, in partnership with the Meals on Wheels Association of America and the International Association of Fire Chiefs, to reduce fire-related injuries and loss of life and property among homebound older adults.

properties.title: ¡Atención! Tenga precaución con alguien que haya sufrido una conmoción cerebral
properties.description: Todos los años, en los Estados Unidos se registran hasta 3.8 millones de casos de conmoción cerebral en actividades deportivas o recreativas. Este Podcast es una entrevista por radio con la Dra. Ileana Arias sobre la iniciativa titulada "Atención: conmoción cerebral en el deporte juvenil" de CDC que ofrece información a los entrenadores, los padres y los atletas sobre prevención, reconocimiento y reacción frente a una conmoción.

properties.title: Staphylococcus aureus resistente a la meticilina (SARM)
properties.description: Datos importantes sobre las infecciones por SARM en Estados Unidos, en las escuelas y los entornos médicos. (Title: Methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus (MRSA)Created: 10/2007)

properties.title: Protect Yourself from Carbon Monoxide Poisoning
properties.description: Learn about carbon monoxide - a colorless, odorless gas - and how to protect yourself and your family.

properties.title: Electronic Aggression
properties.description: Aggression is no longer limited to the school yard. New forms of electronic media, such as blogs, instant messaging, chat rooms, email, text messaging, and the internet are providing new arenas for youth violence to occur.

properties.title: Family History - An Early Warning for Your Child
properties.description: Collecting family history information could save your child's life. Listen to learn more about how knowing your family history information could benefit your entire family.

properties.title: Pap Tests and Foreign-Born Women
properties.description: Foreign-born women living in the U.S. are less likely to have Pap tests to detect cervical cancer than women born in this country. The problem is worse for women from certain countries or regions. Find out why this is a disturbing trend, who these women are and why they are less likely to get a Pap test, and what CDC is doing about it.

properties.title: Twelve Holiday Health and Safety Tips
properties.description: Give the gift of health and safety to yourself and others by following these holiday tips.

properties.title: Use of Facemasks and Respirators
properties.description: This program demonstrates the differences of facemasks and respirators that are to be used in public settings during an influenza pandemic.

properties.title: Take Care of Yourself After an Amputation or Other Surgery
properties.description: This podcast provides health information for amputees on how to take care of yourself after an amputation or other surgery.

properties.title: Taking Care of Your New Arm or Leg After an Amputation
properties.description: This podcast provides health information on taking care of a new arm or leg after an amputation.

properties.title: Happy Handwashing Song
properties.description: This song (sung to the tune of Happy Birthday) encourages kids to wash their hands with soap and water to keep germs away. The song is sung twice through, the recommended length of time to wash hands. Sing along!

properties.title: Cough and Cold Medications for Children
properties.description: This podcast discusses the safety concerns of cough and cold medications and children.

properties.title: Medicamentos para la tos y el resfriado y los niños
properties.description: Este podcast habla sobre las preocupaciones de salud relaciondas con el consumo de medicamentos para la tos y el resfriado en los niños, sin la supervisión de los padres.

properties.title: Ida's Story - Be Smart. Be Well. STD Videos
properties.description: This video, produced by Be Smart. Be Well., raises awareness of Sexually Transmitted Diseases (STDs): 1) What are they? 2) Why they matter? and, 3) What can I do about them? Footage courtesy of <a href="http://www.besmartbewell.com">Be Smart. Be Well.</a>, featuring CDC's Dr. John Douglas, Division of Sexually Transmitted Disease Prevention.

properties.title: Molly's Story - Be Smart. Be Well. STD Videos
properties.description: This video, produced by Be Smart. Be Well., raises awareness of Sexually Transmitted Diseases (STDs): 1) What are they? 2) Why they matter? and, 3) What can I do about them? Footage courtesy of <a href="http://www.besmartbewell.com">Be Smart. Be Well.</a>

properties.title: What Is It? - Be Smart. Be Well. STD Videos
properties.description: This video, produced by Be Smart. Be Well., raises awareness of Sexually Transmitted Diseases (STDs): 1) What are they? 2) Why they matter? and, 3) What can I do about them? Footage courtesy of <a href="http://www.besmartbewell.com">Be Smart. Be Well.</a>, featuring CDC's Dr. John Douglas, Division of Sexually Transmitted Disease Prevention.

properties.title: What Can I Do About It? - Be Smart. Be Well. STD Videos
properties.description: This video, produced by Be Smart. Be Well., raises awareness of Sexually Transmitted Diseases (STDs): 1) What are they? 2) Why they matter? and, 3) What can I do about them? Footage courtesy of <a href="http://www.besmartbewell.com">Be Smart. Be Well.</a>

properties.title: Street Stories - Be Smart. Be Well. STD Videos
properties.description: This video, produced by Be Smart. Be Well., raises awareness of Sexually Transmitted Diseases (STDs): 1) What are they? 2) Why they matter? and, 3) What can I do about them? Footage courtesy of <a href="http://www.besmartbewell.com">Be Smart. Be Well.</a>

properties.title: Overview - Be Smart. Be Well. STD Videos
properties.description: This video, produced by Be Smart. Be Well., raises awareness of Sexually Transmitted Diseases (STDs): 1) What are they? 2) Why they matter? and, 3) What can I do about them? Footage courtesy of <a href="http://www.besmartbewell.com">Be Smart. Be Well.</a>, featuring CDC's Dr. John Douglas, Division of Sexually Transmitted Disease Prevention.

properties.title: Preventing Older Adult Falls and TBI
properties.description: This podcast provides tips on how older adults can prevent falls and related injuries, such as traumatic brain injuries (TBI).

properties.title: Protecting Yourself and Your Family Against Poisonings
properties.description: Dr. Len Paulozzi, Medical Epidemiologist in CDC's National Center for Injury Prevention and Control, Division of Unintentional Injury Prevention, offers some poisoning prevention tips for audiences of all ages.

properties.title: Ground Water Awareness
properties.description: Protecting our water resources from contamination is a major concern. This podcast emphasizes the importance of private well maintenance and water testing.

properties.title: Living in a Clean and Healthy World
properties.description: This podcast is about the importance of effective sanitation programs and steps people can take to stay healthy, including proper hand washing.

properties.title: Learn More About Cerebral Palsy
properties.description: This podcast describes the causes, preventions, types, and signs and symptoms of cerebral palsy.

properties.title: Taking Care After A Concussion
properties.description: This podcast describes how to take care of yourself after a concussion, including proper recognition and response recommendations.

properties.title: Know the Facts: Understand Concussion
properties.description: This podcast discusses concussions and provides information to help people better understand concussion.

properties.title: What You Need to Know About Concussion
properties.description: This podcast provides the essential facts about concussions and describes symptoms, danger signs, and ways to recover and heal after a concussion.

properties.title: Chagas Disease: No Longer Exotic
properties.description: This podcast is designed to inform health care providers about Chagas disease, diagnosis, and treatment and to assist in identifying infected patients.

properties.title: Creating an Asthma-Friendly School
properties.description: This podcast features real-life success stories of students with asthma who, thanks to their schools' implementation of asthma-friendly policies and programs, now have their asthma under control.

properties.title: La enfermedad de Chagas ya no es tan exótica
properties.description: Este podcast tiene el propósito de informar a los profesionales de la salud sobre la enfermedad de Chagas, su diagnóstico y tratamiento, así como orientar en la identificación de pacientes infectados.

properties.title: Prom Health and Safety Tips
properties.description: Follow these tips to make sure your prom is safe and healthy!

properties.title: Malaria Matters
properties.description: This podcast gives an overview of malaria, including prevention and treatment, and what CDC is doing to help control and prevent malaria globally.

properties.title: Safe Drinking Water
properties.description: Listen to this podcast to learn more about the steps that are taken to bring you clean tap water.

properties.title: Walkable Communities
properties.description: This podcast is for a general audience and discusses the benefits of walkable communities, as they relate to health, the environment, and social interaction.

properties.title: Going Green
properties.description: This podcast is for a general audience and provides information on how to recycle, re-use, and restore. It also covers the benefits of “Going Green" on the environment, health, and social interaction.

properties.title: Stopping the Silent Killer: Hepatitis B Among Asian Americans
properties.description: This podcast discusses an underappreciated health threat to many Asians and Pacific Islanders in the United States: chronic infection with the hepatitis B virus. Dr. John Ward, director of CDC's Division of Viral Hepatitis, and Dr. Sam So, founder of the Asian Liver Center at Stanford University, address the importance of testing, vaccination, and care to prevent serious health consequences from this "silent" disease.

properties.title: Help Your Teen Driver Stay Safe
properties.description: Graduated drivers licensing, or GDL, is a system implemented in most states to help teens get safer experience on the roads as they learn to drive. This podcast, for parents of teen drivers, talks about GDL and how it can keep teens safer on the roads- during prom season and all year long.

properties.title: Improve Health for All: REACH 2010
properties.description: The future of health of the nation will be determined to a large extent by how effectively we work with communities to reduce and eliminate health disparities between non-minority and minority populations. This podcast illustrates CDC's REACH 2010 initiative – Racial and Ethnic Approaches to Community Health – which funds innovative programs across the United States.

properties.title: United Nations Secretary General Ban Ki-Moon Visits CDC
properties.description: United Nations Secretary General Ban Ki-Moon recently visited CDC and thanked CDC staff for their partnership with the WHO and contributions to meeting global health goals, including controlling malaria, reducing deaths from measles, working to eradicate polio and guinea worm, and containing avian flu.

properties.title: Hand Hygiene Saves Lives: Patient Admission Video
properties.description: This podcast is for hospital patients and visitors. It emphasizes two key points to help prevent infections: the importance of practicing hand hygiene while in the hospital, and that it's appropriate to ask or remind healthcare providers to practice hand hygiene.

properties.title: La higiene de las manos salva vidas: Video para el ingreso de pacientes
properties.description: Este podcast está dirigido a los pacientes y visitantes del hospital. El video pone énfasis en dos puntos cruciales para ayudar a prevenir infecciones: la importancia de practicar la higiene de las manos durante la estancia en el hospital y el hecho de que es apropiado recordar a los profesionales de la salud que practiquen esta higiene.

properties.title: Safe in the City: Intervention Development and Study Findings
properties.description: In this podcast, Dr. Lee Warner discusses the development and study findings of the Safe in the City intervention with Dr. Kees Rietmeijer.

properties.title: Safe in the City: Intervention for STD Clinics and Prevention Programs
properties.description: In this podcast, Dr. John Douglas talks with Dr. Mary McFarlane about the importance of the Safe in the City intervention for STD clinics and STD prevention programs.

properties.title: New HIV Estimates for the United States, Part One: Interview with Dr. Kevin Fenton
properties.description: In this podcast, Dr. Kevin Fenton presents the new HIV estimates for the United States.

properties.title: New HIV Estimates for the United States, Part Two: Interview with Dr. Richard Wolitski
properties.description: In this podcast, Dr. Richard Wolitski talks about the populations affected by HIV.

properties.title: New HIV Estimates for the United States, Part Three: Interview with Dr. Irene Hall
properties.description: In this podcast, Dr. Irene Hall discusses the methods used estimating HIV in the United States.

properties.title: A Sentinel Event: CDC Releases New HIV Incidence Estimates for the United States
properties.description: This podcast highlights our nation's new HIV incidence estimates, explains their significance, and confirms populations most severely impacted by HIV and AIDS.

properties.title: CDC-Developed Breakthrough Technology Allows Clearest Picture to Date of HIV Infections in the U.S.: A Methods Discussion
properties.description: This podcast describes the first national surveillance system of its kind in the world that is based on direct measurement of new HIV infections.

properties.title: Break the Silence: Stop the Violence
properties.description: In this podcast, parents talk with real teens before dating, stay involved in their lives, and role model to help young people develop healthy, respectful relationships.

properties.title: Next Steps: CDC's Response to the New HIV Incidence Estimates for the United States
properties.description: This podcast addresses CDC's HIV prevention efforts in relation to the new HIV incidence estimates.

properties.title: Talk About Nitpicking! Back-to-School and Head Lice
properties.description: Head lice are a fairly common problem, especially in preschool and elementary school children. This podcast will help you understand how people get head lice, and how to get rid of them!

properties.title: A New Era of Preparedness
properties.description: This podcast describes what CDC is doing to ensure that you and your family are safer and healthier in these ever-changing times. Preparing people for emerging health threats is one of CDC's overarching goals.

properties.title: Meningitis Immunization for Adolescents
properties.description: In this podcast, adolescent vaccine recommendations for meningococcal disease, also known as meningitis, are discussed.

properties.title: Pertussis or Whooping Cough Vaccine Recommendation for Adolescents
properties.description: This podcast provides information on pertussis and the Tdap vaccine recommendations for adolescents.

properties.title: Positive Parenting Tips: Babies
properties.description: This podcast offers positive ways to help the development of your baby.

properties.title: Positive Parenting Tips: Toddlers
properties.description: This podcast offers positive ways to help the development of your toddler.

properties.title: Positive Parenting Tips: Preschoolers
properties.description: This podcast offers positive ways to help the development of your preschooler.

properties.title: Positive Parenting Tips: Middle Childhood
properties.description: This podcast offers positive tips as your child goes through middle childhood.

properties.title: Positive Parenting Tips: Early and Middle Adolescence
properties.description: This podcast offers positive tips as your child goes through adolescence.

properties.title: Traumatic Events and Suicide
properties.description: This podcast includes the phone number for a national hotline resource.

properties.title: Tips for College Health and Safety
properties.description: This podcast discusses steps you can take to be safer and healthier at college.

properties.title: Welcome to Parenthood
properties.description: This short video podcast offers a lighter look at the trials of being a new parent.

properties.title: National HIV Testing Day
properties.description: Dr. Kevin A. Fenton, Director of CDC's National Center for HIV/AIDS, Viral Hepatitis, STD, and TB Prevention, discusses National HIV Testing Day, an annual observance which raises awareness of the importance of knowing one's HIV status and encourages at-risk individuals to get an HIV test.

properties.title: Scarlet Fever
properties.description: Katherine Fleming-Dutra, pediatrician, discusses scarlet fever, its cause, how to treat it, and how to prevent its spread.

properties.title: 30 Years of HIV/AIDS
properties.description: Dr. Kevin A. Fenton, Director of CDC's National Center for HIV/AIDS, Viral Hepatitis, STD, and TB Prevention, discusses the 30 year anniversary of the first reported cases of acquired immunodeficiency syndrome, or AIDS. Dr. Fenton also reflects on the HIV/AIDS epidemic – past, present, and future.

properties.title: Prion Disease: Learn the Facts. Avoid Exposure.
properties.description: This podcast discusses prion diseases and the risk of exposure associated with some common activities.

properties.title: Protect Your Baby from Group B Strep
properties.description: In this podcast, Tarayn Fairlie, a pediatrician and mom, talks about group B strep in pregnant women, the serious effects it can have on newborns, how you can find out if you have group B strep bacteria in your body and what to do to prevent spreading it to your infant.

properties.title: Supporting a Healthy Planet
properties.description: In this podcast, Liz York, CDC's Chief Sustainability Officer, discusses tips for environmental stewardship and CDC's plans for Earth Day.

properties.title: Salt Matters: Preserving Choice, Protecting Health (Long Version)
properties.description: This video presents information about salt as a major contributor to high blood pressure, heart disease, and stroke.

properties.title: Laboratories: Integrating Services
properties.description: This podcast highlights the importance of integrating laboratory services to maximize service delivery to patients.

properties.title: Sexual Violence
properties.description: This podcast discusses sexual violence - what it is, the long-term health problems it can contribute to, and tips to stop it before it begins.

properties.title: Put Your Hands Together
properties.description: In this podcast, learn how to help stop the spread of infection and stay healthy. It's easy when you 'Put Your Hands Together.'

properties.title: Fighting the Flu
properties.description: Wes Studi, Hollywood actor, urges Native peoples to know the facts about the flu.

properties.title: National Toxic Substance Incidents Program (NTSIP)
properties.description: This podcast gives an overview of the three components of the National Toxic Substance Incidents Program: state surveillance, national database, and response teams.

properties.title: Salt Matters: Preserving Choice, Protecting Health (Short Version)
properties.description: This video presents information about salt as a major contributor to high blood pressure, heart disease, and stroke.

properties.title: VSI – Vaccine Scene Investigation
properties.description: Watch this short, fun video that will remind everyone why it's so important for adults to get vaccinated.

properties.title: Hablemos de la Influenza
properties.description: En la charla, un médico responde a las preguntas frecuentes sobre la vacuna contra la influenza (gripe).

properties.title: Global Disease Detectives in Kibera
properties.description: In partnership with our disease detectives, urban poor open their homes to the world to prevent and control emerging diseases.

properties.title: Business/Employers Influenza Toolkit
properties.description: This podcast promotes the "Make It Your Business To Fight The Flu" toolkit for Businesses and Employers. This toolkit provides information and recommended strategies to help businesses and employers promote the 2010 – 2011 seasonal flu vaccine. Additionally, employers will find flyers, posters, and other materials to post and distribute in the workplace.

properties.title: Hand, Foot, and Mouth Disease
properties.description: In this podcast, CDC's Adam Cohen, MD, a pediatrician and dad, talks about hand, foot, and mouth disease; its symptoms; and practical tips to prevent your family from getting sick with the virus.

properties.title: Learn More Breathe Better
properties.description: Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) is a serious lung disease that makes breathing very difficult and can affect your quality of life. Learn the causes of COPD and what you can do to prevent it.

properties.title: Homeless and Policy – Part I

properties.title: Homeless and Policy – Part II
properties.description: Homelessness in the 21st century is an ongoing problem, increasing due to the country's recent economic downturn, especially in urban areas. This podcast discusses how homelessness impacts policy and what public health professionals can do about it.

properties.title: Homelessness and Health – Part I
properties.description: Homelessness in the 21st century is an ongoing problem, increasing due to the country's recent economic downturn, especially in urban areas. This podcast discusses how homelessness impacts health and what public health professionals can do about it.

properties.title: Homelessness and Health – Part II
properties.description: Homelessness in the 21st century is an ongoing problem, increasing due to the country's recent economic downturn, especially in urban areas. This podcast discusses how homelessness impacts health and what public health professionals can do about it.

properties.title: Pregnant Women Need a Flu Shot
properties.description: This podcast explains why pregnant women need a flu shot.

properties.title: Pregnant Women: Know the Signs and Symptoms of Flu
properties.description: This podcast is targeted to pregnant women and explains 1) the signs and symptoms of the flu, and 2) what to do if you experience and signs and symptoms. This podcast is NOT a substitute for the advice of your doctor or health care provider. It is intended for educational purposes only.

properties.title: Parents Are the Key to Safe Teen Drivers
properties.description: This podcast offers information to help parents keep their teen drivers safer on the road.

properties.title: Pink Eye: What To Do
properties.description: In this podcast, CDC's Adam Cohen, MD, a pediatrician and parent, discusses conjunctivitis (pink eye), a common eye condition in children and adults. He reviews pink eye causes and treatment, suggestions on when to call or visit a doctor, and practical tips to prevent pink eye from spreading.

properties.title: Talking to Your Patients: A Clinician’s Guide to Treating Mild Traumatic Brain Injury
properties.description: This podcast describes how to talk to your patients and provide health information about mild traumatic brain injury (mild TBI) that may help ease their concerns and can give them tools to help speed their recovery.

properties.title: Warning Signs: Seasonal Flu
properties.description: In this podcast, Dr. Joe Bresee describes the main symptoms of seasonal flu and when it is serious enough to seek medical help.

properties.title: Take Three: Seasonal Flu
properties.description: In this podcast, Dr. Joe Bresee describes how to keep from getting seasonal flu and spreading it to others by taking these three steps.

properties.title: Don't Get, Don't Spread: Seasonal Flu
properties.description: In this podcast, Dr. Joe Bresee describes how to keep from getting the seasonal flu and spreading it to others.

properties.title: Antiviral Drugs: Seasonal Flu
properties.description: In this podcast, Dr. Joe Bresee explains the nature of antiviral drugs and how they are used for seasonal flu.

properties.title: Influenza 2010-2011: ACIP Vaccination Recommendations
properties.description: In this podcast targeted to clinicians, Dr. Joe Bresee discusses who should be vaccinated against seasonal flu during the 2010-2011 season. He explains who is at risk for severe illness from the flu and discusses the benefits of vaccination.

properties.title: Health Inequities among Men who have Sex with Men
properties.description: Dr. Richard Wolitski, Deputy Director for Behavioral and Social Science in CDC's Division of HIV/AIDS Prevention, discusses how the health of men who have sex with men may be influenced by prejudice and discrimination and impacted by policies, laws, and economic factors.
